intro: Weinmannia geometrica, commonly known as the geometric weinmannia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, geometrically shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in composite heads, which are typical of the daisy family. Weinmannia geometrica is often found in rocky or sandy soils in arid environments. Its unique foliage makes it a popular choice for xeriscaping and rock gardens.
